page.title: 12Other clubs and societies.
page.content: The Brampton Golf Club entrance is almost opposite the entrance to Talkin Tarn. The course has eighteen holes and covers an area of about 100 acres. Membership is in the region of a hundred and sixty with a committee of fourteen. Sixty to seventy visitors can be expected to play there in a busy week. A professional and his assistant are available. Every week, the professional and the club captain take on two different players. A new club house is nearing completion. An indoor bowling club meets regularly during the winter months in Milton Village Hall. They take part in matches with other local bowling clubs. Brampton Anglers have fishing rights along the river Gelt.
